Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won the match by 5 wickets (with 18 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan's middle and lower orders collapsed against Afghanistan, leaving No. 10 Naseem Shah with the task of hitting big blows to get them across the line
Sri Lanka's batting has only clicked more recently and, even then, almost exclusively while chasing
Pakistan have relied a little more heavily on Mohammad Rizwan, who is one of only two batters with more than 200 runs in the tournament so far
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam has been having a poor stretch this Asia Cup
Charith Asalanka has made 0, 1, 8, and 0 so far, eating up 21 balls for those nine runs
Pakistan may give Naseem a break for Hasan Ali and there is also a chance that Shadab Khan might be rested, with Usman Qadir coming in
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sixteen of the last 18 matches in Dubai - not counting the result between India and Afghanistan on Thursday night - have been won by the chasing side
The Dubai pitch is expected to favour the team batting second, with dew perhaps forming in the second innings to hamper the bowlers
Others: Sri Lanka and Pakistan in dress rehearsal for final
Opportunity for Babar Azam to get back among the runs after a string of low scores; both sides likely to rest key bowlers
